result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan C. Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan C. Torres is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan C. Torres was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges are allowed
It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.
 ***COURT GRANTS THE MOTION FOR ELM***

Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John Ward. Clerk LE. Judicial notice taken of judgment of conviction in 08CF420. Def. waives any potential conflict of interest by having same attorney or firm represent him and his co-def. KPD Det. Eric Traxler sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Ward. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 9-4-14 @ 8:30am with co-def. Bond continued.       03-06-17 Correction to Minutes:  Court reporter was Lori T. for hearing.  jt

2:14 pm    Atty Zach Wittchow appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk;  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on  7-31-14 @ 9:15 am.  $3000 cash bond set with conditions.

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug para.  *No Contact w/ Anthony T, Jessica F, or Joana P or their residences.
